lines.text:
[to Crunk]
Never give a sucker an even break and always keep an eye on your pals.
Now watch this.
[rolls dice]
Seven.
How do you do it?
Influence. You bring me the right people, I'll get you that hundred thousand.
But it's gambling!
Not the way I do it.
You don't belong with a grifter like me. You just got some mud on your dress, that's all. Give it time, let it dry. It'll brush off.
Never Give a sucker an even break. But don't cheat a friend. I believe in that, I live by it. You don't think I'd play phony with you, well, you lost.
Oh but I didn't know the rules of the game.

[Calling to handyman after slot machine pays off]
Hey, Blubber! Fix this thing!
Something wrong, boss?
It pays!

[to Dorothy]
You bring me the right people; I'll get you that hundred thousand.
But it's gambling!

[smiling]
Not the way I do it.

[angrily to Joe]
Get out of here! Get out of here! Get your greasy black head out of here!
You don't mind if I double-cross myself, do you?

[as Joe enters the car]
Where did you get hat butt?

[Smoking with an abdominal bullet wound]
Well, i promoted it off a guy.
One cough out of you, and you'll fill this seat with oatmeal.
Why don't you join the army?

[showing her his draft card]
4-F.
You look 1-A to me.
You don't look so bad yourself... Well, it's my arteries.
Should you be giving blood?
[they're in line at the Blood Bank]
My blood is 1-A. Just my arteries are 4-F.

[as they're waiting in line to donate blood]
Here I am giving my life's blood, and she don't trust my motives.
The person who gets your life's blood will probably develop a sudden passion for the "dump" shot.
Yeah, and the poor soldier that gets *your* blood, they can use him for an ice cube!
